intro: Epacris alba-odorata, commonly known as the white-fragrant epacris, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its fragrant blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Epacris alba-odorata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
